alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Panola (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 10:43PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Webster, north central De Soto, southern Caddo, central Bienville and southern Bossier Parishes, southeastern Harrison and northeastern Panola Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1043 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Marshall to near Blanchard to near Eastwood. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Marshall, Haughton, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Stonewall, Ringgold, Doyline, Heflin, Deberry, Elysian Fields, Eastwood, Fosters, Scottsville, Bienville, Jamestown, Ferguson and Curtis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana...and northeastern Texas.
